raw_text:
Lee to create new film superhero
 
 Comic book veteran Stan Lee is to team up with producer Robert Evans to create a movie featuring a new superhero.
 
 Foreverman will focus on a character who has to face problems in everyday life as well as using his special powers to save the world. Paramount Pictures, the studio behind the film, have revealed few details about the project but say it has the potential to spawn a series of films. Lee is best known for his work on Spider-Man and The Incredible Hulk.
 
 He is collaborating on the script with screenwriter Peter Briggs, who penned the recent comic book adaptation Hellboy. "We believe it to be truly a whole new franchise," said Gill Champion, president and chief executive of Lee's POW! Entertainment. "In this world where people are looking for something different, Stan's idea was to create a concept not seen before to become an evergreen franchise for Paramount." Many of Lee's other creations, including X-Men and Daredevil, have been turned into films in the past five years. However, the Spider-Man series has been the biggest box office hit, with the 2002 original and its 2004 sequel taking almost $1.6bn (£857m) worldwide. A third Spider-Man film is scheduled for release in 2007. Another Marvel Comics adaptation, The Fantastic Four, will be released in cinemas this summer.
llama3.2:1b: Stan Lee to team up with Robert Evans to create new superhero movie "Foreverman".
Details include the project's potential for a series of films and Lee's collaboration on the script with Peter Briggs.
llama3.2:3b: Stan Lee to team up with Robert Evans to create a new superhero movie called Foreverman, which will focus on everyday problems and special powers, potentially spawning a series of films.
gemma2:2b: Stan Lee will collaborate with producer Robert Evans to create a new superhero movie called "Foreverman."
The movie will focus on a character who deals with everyday issues and uses his powers to save the world.
Paramount Pictures plans to develop a series of films based on the project.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Marvel's Stan Lee is to team up with Robert Evans on a new superhero movie called Foreverman.
It focuses on a character who has to face problems in life and use his powers to save the world.
Paramount Pictures plans to bring it to screens next year, although many Spider-Man adaptations have been successful in theaters.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Comic book veteran Stan Lee teaming up with producer Robert Evans to create a new superhero movie featuring a character dealing with everyday life alongside using special powers to save the world, based on Foreverman concept with script by screenwriter Peter Briggs for Paramount Pictures.
Known for Spider-Man and The Incredible Hulk, Lee has previously adapted X-Men and Daredevil into films that have been successful in the past five years.
qwen2.5:3b: Comic book veteran Stan Lee is collaborating with producer Robert Evans to create a new superhero film featuring "Foreverman," a character who deals with everyday issues and uses superpowers to save the world.
Paramount Pictures supports the project, which has the potential to launch a franchise.
The film is co-written by Peter Briggs, known for his work on Hellboy.
Lee's other Marvel Comics creations have been successful in film form; however, the Spider-Man series remains the biggest box office hit with its three films grossing almost $1.6bn worldwide.
Another Marvel adaptation, The Fantastic Four, will be released this summer.
opencoder:1.5b: "Comic book veteran Stan Lee is to team up with producer Robert Evans to create a movie featuring a new superhero."
"ForEverman has been focusing on a character who has to face problems in everyday life as well as using his special powers to save the world.
The studio behind the project, Paramount Pictures have revealed few details about the project but say it has the potential to spawn a series of films."
"Has he collaborated with screenwriter Peter Briggs?"
"In this world where people are looking for something different, Stan's idea was to create a concept not seen before to become an evergreen franchise for Paramount."
"This includes several of Lee's other creations including X-Men and Daredevil that have been turned into films in the past five years.
However, The Spider-Man series has been the biggest box office hit, with the 2002 original and its 2004 sequel taking almost $1.6bn (£857m) worldwide."
"In addition, a third Spider-Man film is scheduled for release in 2007."
"Will another Marvel Comics adaptation, The Fantastic Four, be released in cinemas this summer?"

deepseek-r1:1.5b: Stan Lee and Peter Briggs are collaborating to create a new superhero film featuring a character inspired by human-like powers, focusing on overcoming challenges in everyday life.
Based on the recent Hellboy comic book adaptation, this could be the start of a series.
The Spider-Man franchise, which has had significant success with the 2002 original and its 2004 sequel, is expected to gross nearly $1.6 billion worldwide.
A third Spider-Man film will be released in 2007, and Marvel's adaptation of The Fantastic Four is also on the release shelf this summer.
tinyllama:1.1b: Lee to create new film superhero, Foreverman to star and produce, set to release next year as part of a series of films from Stan Lee's new production company.
Foreverman is based on a character created by Lee in comic book series and is said to have the potential to spawn multiple movies.
The project marks Lee's first film collaboration since 2004 when he starred in X-Men and its sequel.
Foreverman was announced earlier this year, after Lee collaborated with screenwriter Peter Briggs on a script for Hellboy.

Many of Lee's other creation projects have been adapted into films in the past five years, but the Spider-Man series has been the biggest box office hit to date, with The Amazing Spider-Man and its sequel set for release next summer.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Lee, a well-known comic book veteran and a renowned creator of superheroes, has recently been tapped by producers Robert Evans to create a film featuring a new hero.
This project is set to be a blockbuster and marks the first time a character created by Stan Lee will not only appear in a movie but also have multiple films planned for its franchise.
The potential for success is evident, with numerous Marvel Comics properties having become immensely popular over the past five years.
As for the plot of the film, it is set to focus on a character who has to deal with everyday problems alongside using his unique powers to save the world from various threats.

Entertainment have already expressed their belief that this new film will be a truly groundbreaking addition to the comic book movie franchise, with the possibility of several sequels being developed for the future.
The success of previous Marvel movies has also provided inspiration for this project, which is set to be released in 2007.
phi:2.7b: Stan Lee, known for works like "Spider-Man" and "The Incredible Hulk," will team up with producer Robert Evans to create a new superhero movie titled Foreverman.
This film focuses on a character who faces everyday problems while using special powers to save the world.
Paramount Pictures has revealed that this could lead to a series of films, but no details are available yet.
Many of Lee's other creations have been turned into movies in recent years, but "Spider-Man" remains his biggest box office hit with two successful sequels taking almost $1.6bn worldwide.
Another Marvel Comics adaptation, The Fantastic Four, will be released this summer.
orca-mini:3b: Stan Lee and Robert Evans are creating a new movie superhero called Foreverman, which is set to star in a series of films.
The movie focuses on a character with powers who saves the world from everyday problems.
Entertainment is collaborating with screenwriter Peter Briggs on the script.
The Spider-Man and X-Men franchises have already been turned into movies, but Foreverman has the potential to become an evergreen franchise for Paramount Pictures.
The movie is scheduled to be released in 2007.

The character faces everyday problems while using special powers to save the world.
Paramount Pictures sees it as potentially spawning a series of films, following similar adaptations of Stan Lee's other creations like Spider-Man, The Incredible Hulk, X-Men, and Daredevil.

granite3.1-dense:2b: Stan Lee, renowned comic book creator known for Spider-Man and The Incredible Hulk, is partnering with producer Robert Evans to develop a film series featuring a new superhero named Foreverman.
This character grapples with everyday issues while wielding extraordinary powers to save the world.
Lee will work on the script alongside screenwriter Peter Briggs, who previously wrote Hellboy.

Paramount Pictures, which will produce the films, views this project as a potential multi-film franchise, aiming to cater to audiences seeking fresh concepts post-popular series like Spider-Man and Fantastic Four.
